meanings.definition: Capable of being influenced or persuaded.
meanings.sent1: She was swayable and quickly agreed to join the team.
meanings.sent2: The swayable child easily changed his mind about which toy he wanted.
meanings.sent3: The swayable puppy couldn't resist the temptation of the treat.
meanings.sent4: Her opinion was as swayable as a leaf in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The swayable student soaked up every word of the inspiring speech.

meanings.definition: Able to be swayed or moved easily.
meanings.sent1: The curtains by the window were swayable in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: The swayable branches of the tree danced in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The swayable boat rocked gently on the calm water.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were as swayable as the waves of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The swayable reeds swayed gracefully along the riverbank.
